## Define a function to write text in typewriter font
tt <- function(x) {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output()) {
    sprintf("\\texttt{%s}", as.character(x))
  } else if (knitr::is_html_output()) {
    sprintf("<tt>%s</tt>", as.character(x))
  } else {
    x
  }
}

# Setup

## Libraries

```{r libs, warning = FALSE}
library(httr)
library(xml2)

library(purrr)
library(stringr)
```

## Retrieve Data from `r tt("AoC")`


```{r get-data, cache = FALSE, messages = FALSE}
session_cookie <- set_cookies(session = keyring::key_get("AoC-GitHub-Cookie"))
base_url <- paste0("https://adventofcode.com/", params$year, "/day/", params$task_nr)
puzzle <- GET(base_url,
              session_cookie) %>% 
  content(encoding = "UTF-8") %>% 
  xml_find_all("///article") %>% 
  lapply(as.character)

parse_puzzle_data <- function(text_block = readClipboard()) {
  if (length(text_block) == 1L) {
    text_block <- text_block %>% 
      str_split("\n") %>% 
      extract2(1L) %>% 
      keep(nzchar)
  }
  text_block %>% 
    str_split(",|-") %>% 
    do.call(rbind, .) %>% 
    set_colnames(c("l1", "r1", "l2", "r2")) %>% 
    as_tibble() %>% 
    mutate(across(everything(), as.integer))
    
}

puzzle_data <- local({
  GET(paste0(base_url, "/input"),
      session_cookie) %>% 
    content(encoding = "UTF-8") %>% 
    parse_puzzle_data()
})
```

# Puzzle Day `r params$task_nr`

## Part 1

### Description

```{r show-puzzle-a, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
cat(puzzle[[1]])
```

### Solution

For each assignment we check whether the intervals contain each other by checking their 
boundaries.

```{r get-solution-1}
count_containing <- function(assignments) {
  assignments %>% 
    mutate(does_contain = (l1 >= l2 & r1 <= r2) |
             (l2 >= l1 & r2 <= r1)) %>% 
    summarize(contains = sum(does_contain)) %>% 
    pull(contains)
}

count_containing(puzzle_data)
```

## Part 2

### Description

```{r show-puzzle-b, echo = FALSE, results = "asis", eval = length(puzzle) > 1}
cat(puzzle[[2]])
```

### Solution

The same idea applies here, but we just need to check wther left and right boundaries are
overlapping.


```{r get-solution-2}
count_overlapping <- function(assignments) {
  assignments %>% 
    mutate(does_overlap = (r1 >= l2 & l1 <= r2) |
             (l1 <= r2 & r1 >= r2)) %>% 
    summarize(overlaps = sum(does_overlap)) %>% 
    pull(overlaps)
}

count_overlapping(puzzle_data)
```
